page.title: 01Landscape Description
page.content: In this area there is a lot of coniferous woodland eg Kulmix Wood.Most of the woodland has been planted by man.The woodland ,if joined together,would take up approximately 2-3 kilometers.There are several small streams,and at the edge of Carlurlie Water Reservoir lies in the area (see photo's).There isn't much settlement in the area but there are a few farm buildings at Greenside,Annfield and Kilmix.The main use of the land is mixed farming,along with forestry.The maximum height in the area is 198m. Main roads and minor roads can be seen in this area,the A road is the A916(Kennoway to Cupar) which passes the only school between Bonnybank and Craigrothie.
